availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Frederick William Reutlinger (Henderson County, Kentucky, city clerk, councilman, and merchant)

body.p: Henderson County, Kentucky, clerk, councilman, and merchant. Native of Prussia. Married to Barbara Reutlinger in Louisville, Kentucky, on November 29, 1852. Father of William A. Reutlinger, Eugene Reutlinger, and Mary Reutlinger. Clerk in Henderson County in 1850. Councilman in Henderson County from 1858 to 1859. Merchant in Henderson County in 1860. City clerk in Henderson County in 1861. Clerk in Henderson County in 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Henderson County, Henderson, District 1, p. 275A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Henderson County, Division 1, p. 49.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Henderson County, Henderson, p. 137A.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War) NARA RG 110, Henderson County, KY, July 1863, p. 268.
“Death of Prominent German,” The Owensboro Messenger (Owensboro, KY), Feb. 17, 1904, p. 1.
Edmund L. Starling, History of Henderson County, Kentucky (Henderson, KY: Edmund L. Starling, 1887), 371.
"F. W. Reutlinger (1828-1904)," Find A Grave, Memorial #85556208, accessed July 27, 2021, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/85556208.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Jefferson County Marriages, Film #000819596.
KYR-0001-017-0159.
